results.title: The Barber of Seville = Il Barbiere di Siviglia
results.creator_credit: Mario Costa, Ugo Trombetti, Mario Trombetti and Tespi
results.brief_description: Filmed in black and white, this feature length production of Gioacchino Rossini’s comic opera “The Barber of Seville” in three acts, with libretto by Cesare Sterbini and based on the play by Pierre Beaumarchais, was shot in Rome and stars one of Italy’s most famous opera singers, Tito Gobbi, in the role of Figaro the town barber. Figaro is the unsung hero as he ingeniously plots and schemes his way around a love triangle between Count Almaviva (Ferruccio Tagliavini), the young and beautiful Rosina (Nelly Corradi) who the Count madly adores, and Dr Bartolo (Vito De Taranto), Rosina’s strict guardian who also fancies Rosina and wants to make her his wife. It is through Figaro’s amazing disguises and interferences that finally outwit Dr Bartolo, allowing the two lovers to eventually elope. Features the Orchestra and Chorus of the Opera of Rome conducted by Giuseppe Morelli and a supporting cast including Italo Tajo, Natalia Nicolini and Nino Mazziotti. Sung in Italian with no English subtitles. NB: Image quality is inconsistent (particularly in the beginning) and sound track is a bit scratchy but production is of historical value.
results.title_for_label: The Barber of Seville = Il Barbiere di Siviglia

results.title: The Balance
results.creator_credit: Karin Altman, Nick Torrens and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
Louis Garneau is a road racing cyclist and an aspiring Canadian artist from Quebec. He pursues his cycling with the intensity that all top athletes must have, but he is also equally absorbed in his other interests: sculpture, painting and furniture making. Here is a very enjoyable story of an exceptional young man’s battle in a 185 kilometre road race.

results.title: Angela and Angella
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
Angela Bailey and Angella Taylor are both ranked in the world’s top ten in the 100 metres sprint. They are fierce rivals and this film shows us the girls’ gruelling daily regimen, their attitudes to one another and to international competition. At the Commonwealth Games of 1982, we watch the way in which their coach handles their triumphs and failures

results.title: The Hurdle
results.creator_credit: Dennis O'Rourke, Nick Torrens and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
Douglas Sam, Australia’s best middleweight boxer, had to overcome enormous psychological pressures at the Commonwealth Games of 1982 in Brisbane. Douglas is an Australian First Nations man, and many of his people felt that he should not compete in these games. He did compete and the news media made Douglas a favourite for a gold medal. This film traces his wins and his losses.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis O’Rourke, Nick Torrens and Film Australia

results.title: Inganarr the giant serpent
results.creator_credit: David Corke, Ken J. Widdowson, Educational Media Australia and Australian National University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Aboriginal legends”.
A serpent with an enormous appetite, Inganarr, ate all the people of North Goulburn Island and then proceeded to eat the people of Arnhem Land. Fortunately Inganarr suffered from indigestion due to his gluttony and the tribespeople poured out of his mouth in droves. This helps to explain why there are people in eastern Arnhem Land but no people in western Arnhem Land. This film is also available as a compilation film entitled Aboriginal legends no. 3. Suitable for middle and upper primary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Corke, Ken J. Widdowson, Educational Media Australia and Australian National University

results.title: We both want to win
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Karin Altmann, Nick Torrens and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
Shows two young Australians preparing for their clash in the 100-metre and 200-metre backstroke finals at the Brisbane Commonwealth Games in 1982. Their approaches are very different. Georgina Parkes is a member of an elite national swim squad coached by the man who brought the Cincinnati Marlins to the top of the United States club championships. Lisa Forrest is trained at a suburban swimming school. The consequences of these two approaches reveal some of the pressures in top-level competition.
Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Roberts, Karin Altmann, Nick Torrens and Film Australia

results.title: You promised me gold
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Nick Torrens and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
This is one of eight programs that look at different athletes preparing themselves for the Commonwealth Games of 1982. Alex Baumann, the athlete studied in this program, is a swimmer who is training for the Games despite a nagging shoulder injury that has prevented him from participating in other competitions.

results.title: Bertland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
The fastest 400 metre runner in the world in 1982 was Bertland Cameron from Spanish Town, Jamaica. Bert is studying at the University of Texas, at El Paso, and is there on an athletics scholarship which requires him to perform at his top if he wants to keep it. The pressure, and the tension it brings, continues as he prepares for the 400 metres final at the 1982 Brisbane Commonwealth Games.
